creator: anders@blaagaard.net
text:
I'm using mod_mem_cache to cache some jsp pages from tomcat (using mod_jk) that
generate slowly. It seems that if the connection is closed (tested using stop
button in browser) while the page is generated, mod_cache will cache the
incomplete part that was sent to the browser. 

A possible work-around is to make sure the jsp buffer size is greater than
MCacheMaxObjectSize.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text: Have you tried using mod_disk_cache instead of mod_mem_cache?

creator: coad@measurement-factory.com
text:
Note that it is fine to cache partial objects.
However, they MUST be revalidated.

Please see bug 15866 showing mod_cache not
revalidating cached partial responses. That
bug was tested with mod_disk_cache.

Presuming these bugs were one in the same.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 15866 ***
